metadata.name: Suspicious Kernel Dump Using Dtrace
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious way to dump the kernel on Windows systems using dtrace.exe, which is available on Windows systems since Windows 10 19H1

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\dtrace.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lkd(0)')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('syscall:::return')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lkd('))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious way to dump the kernel on Windows systems using dtrace.exe, which is available on Windows systems since Windows 10 19H1
